subject: RE: [junit] Help plz...
msgSnippet: setUp is called before every testXXX method. tearDown is called after every testXXX method. In the code I sent, it would go like this LanguageVectorTest.main()
messageBody:
setUp is called before every testXXX method. tearDown is called after every testXXX method.

In the code I sent, it would go like this
LanguageVectorTest.main() runs. This calls suite() which instantiates a Suite containing the LanguageVectorTest class. The test runner will then do something like

for each class in the suite
do
for each method like test* in the class
do
setUp
testXXX
tearDown
done
done

-----Original Message-----
From: Chan [mailto:chanduram@...]
Sent: Wednesday, September 17, 2003 2:59 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Help plz...


Hi CRAIG,

ThankU very much for ur guidance.
I have some doubts :

Firstly...,
I want to know how the program execution goes, from

1. from the command line prompt, java LanguageVectorTest
2. The main() method of LanguageVectorTest is called then
3. Then does it goes to Test suite() method or setUp() method ..?

Secondly,,
Which part of the code constitutes a Test Fixture..
Wat is the actual difference between a test fixture and testcase and test
method. I read the documentation from Junit.org site still, these concepts
are not very clear. Its little confusing.

thanks
Chan

On Tuesday 16 September 2003 11:10 pm, PARDEY, CRAIG wrote:
> I can see a few problems (ignoring the need for refactoring). I have
> changed them in such a way that the test now works for values other than 2.
>
> The things I changed:
> 1. Removed the quotes from the suite
> 2. Split main() into main() and setUp() so the LanguageVector main is
> always called.
>
> The code is attached.
>
>
> import junit.framework.Test;
> import junit.framework.TestCase;
> import junit.framework.TestSuite;
>
> public class LanguageVectorTest extends TestCase
> {
> LanguageVector langvect = new LanguageVector();
> public void testlangvect()
> {
> System.out.println("value of langvect.length" + LanguageVector.length);
> assertEquals(2, LanguageVector.length);
> assertEquals("TOMCAT", LanguageVector.list.elementAt(0));
> assertEquals("EJB", LanguageVector.list.elementAt(1));
> assertEquals("COBOL", LanguageVector.list.elementAt(2));
> }
>
> public static Test suite()
> {
> return new TestSuite(LanguageVectorTest.class);
> }
>
> public void setUp()
> {
> String params[] = { "TOMCAT", "EJB" };
> LanguageVector.main(params);
> }
>
> public static void main(String args[])
> {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
> }
> }
>
> import java.util.Vector;
>
> public class LanguageVector
> {
> static Vector list = new Vector();
> static int length;
> public static void main(String args[])
> {
> length = args.length;
> System.out.println("The size args.length =" + length);
> for (int i = 0; i < length; i++)
> {
> list.addElement(args[i]);
> }
> list.insertElementAt("COBOL", 2);
> int size = list.size();
> System.out.println("The size list.size() =" + size);
> String listArray[] = new String[size];
> list.copyInto(listArray);
> System.out.println("List of Languages");
> for (int i = 0; i < size; i++)
> {
> System.out.println(listArray[i]);
> }
> }
> }
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Chan [mailto:chanduram@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, September 16, 2003 6:22 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Help plz...
>
>
> Hi,
>
> Just go thro this program, it does not run for negative test

>
> regards
> chandu
>

> inserts a element at a specified position and displays */

> import java.io.*;
> class LanguageVector

> static int length;
> public static void main(String args[])
> {
> length= args.length;
> System.out.println("The size args.length ="+length);
> for (int i=0; i<length ; i++)
> {
> list.addElement(args[i]);
> }
> list.insertElementAt("COBOL",2);
> int size= list.size();
> System.out.println("The size list.size() ="+size);
> String listArray[]=new String[size];
> list.copyInto(listArray);
> System.out.println("List of Languages");
> for (int i=0; i<size ; i++)
> {
> System.out.println(listArray[i]);
> }
>
> }
> }
>
>
>

> i have typed */

>

> import java.io.*;
> class TestLanguageVector extends TestCase {
> LanguageVector langvect =new LanguageVector();
> public void testlangvect(){
> System.out.println("value of langvect.length"+langvect.length);
> assertEquals(2,langvect.length);
> /* the assert fails when i give other value than 2, and the program throws
> exception and stops, the next assertion is not tested and no FALIURE mssg
> is given.*/
> assertEquals("COBOL",langvect.list.elementAt(2));
> }
>
> public static Test suite(){
> return new TestSuite("TestLanguageVector.class");
> }
>
>
> public static void main(String args[])
> {
>
> String params[] = {"TOMCAT","EJB"};
> /*I passs parameters to the main () of LanguageVector.java */
> LanguageVector.main(params);
> /*1.If the below two stmts are not added the testlangvect() is not
> getting innitaited */
> /*2. If I run negative test the Faliure msg is not displayed
> the program stops after throwing the first Exception */
>
> TestLanguageVector testlangVector= new TestLanguageVector();
> testlangVector.testlangvect();
